routine.name: abs

routine.name: acos

routine.name: array

routine.name: ascii

routine.name: atan

routine.name: bround

routine.name: cbrt

routine.name: ceil

routine.name: ceiling
routine.Comment: ceiling(x) - Find the smallest integer not smaller than x

routine.name: char_length
routine.Comment: char_length(str | binary) - Returns the number of characters in str or binary data

routine.name: character_length
routine.Comment: character_length(str | binary) - Returns the number of characters in str or binary data

routine.name: chr
routine.Comment: chr(str) - convert n where n : [0, 256) into the ascii equivalent as a varchar.If n is less than 0 return the empty string. If n > 256, return chr(n % 256).

routine.name: coalesce
routine.Comment: coalesce(a1, a2, ...) - Returns the first non-null argument

routine.name: collect_list
routine.Comment: collect_list(x) - Returns a list of objects with duplicates

routine.name: collect_set
routine.Comment: collect_set(x) - Returns a set of objects with duplicate elements eliminated

routine.name: compute_stats
routine.Comment: compute_stats(x) - Returns the statistical summary of a set of primitive type values.

routine.name: concat
routine.Comment: concat(str1, str2, ... strN) - returns the concatenation of str1, str2, ... strN or concat(bin1, bin2, ... binN) - returns the concatenation of bytes in binary data bin1, bin2, ... binN

routine.name: concat_ws
routine.Comment: concat_ws(separator, [string | array(string)]+) - returns the concatenation of the strings separated by the separator.

routine.name: context_ngrams
routine.Comment: context_ngrams(expr, array<string1, string2, ...>, k, pf) estimates the top-k most frequent n-grams that fit into the specified context. The second parameter specifies a string of words that specify the positions of the n-gram elements, with a null value standing in for a 'blank' that must be filled by an n-gram element.

routine.name: conv
routine.Comment: conv(num, from_base, to_base) - convert num from from_base to to_base

routine.name: corr
routine.Comment: corr(y,x) - Returns the Pearson coefficient of correlation

routine.name: cos
routine.Comment: cos(x) - returns the cosine of x (x is in radians)

routine.name: count
routine.Comment: count(*) - Returns the total number of retrieved rows, including rows containing NULL values.

routine.name: covar_pop
routine.Comment: covar_pop(x,y) - Returns the population covariance of a set of number pairs

routine.name: covar_samp
routine.Comment: covar_samp(x,y) - Returns the sample covariance of a set of number pairs

routine.name: crc32
routine.Comment: crc32(str or bin) - Computes a cyclic redundancy check value for string or binary argument and returns bigint value.

routine.name: current_authorizer

routine.name: current_database

routine.name: current_date
routine.Comment: current_date() - Returns the current date at the start of query evaluation. All calls of current_date within the same query return the same value.

routine.name: current_groups
routine.Comment: current_groups() - Returns all groups the current user belongs to

routine.name: current_timestamp

routine.name: current_user

routine.name: date_add

routine.name: find_in_set
routine.Comment: find_in_set(str,str_array) - Returns the first occurrence of str in str_array where str_array is a comma-delimited string. Returns null if either argument is null. Returns 0 if the first argument has any commas.

routine.Comment: floor_hour(param) - Returns the timestamp at a hour granularity

routine.Comment: floor_minute(param) - Returns the timestamp at a minute granularity

routine.name: floor_month
routine.Comment: floor_month(param) - Returns the timestamp at a month granularity

routine.name: floor_year

routine.name: format_number
routine.Comment: format_number(X, D or F) - Formats the number X to a format like '#,###,###.##', rounded to D decimal places, Or Uses the format specified F to format, and returns the result as a string. If D is 0, the result has no decimal point or fractional part. This is supposed to function like MySQL's FORMAT

routine.name: from_unixtime
routine.Comment: from_unixtime(unix_time, format) - returns unix_time in the specified format

routine.name: from_utc_timestamp
routine.Comment: from_utc_timestamp(timestamp, string timezone) - Assumes given timestamp is UTC and converts to given timezone (as of Hive 0.8.0)

routine.name: get_json_object

routine.name: get_splits
routine.Comment: get_splits(string,int) - Returns an array of length int serialized splits for the referenced tables string. Passing length 0 returns only schema data for the compiled query.

routine.name: greatest

routine.name: grouping

routine.name: if
routine.Comment: IF(expr1,expr2,expr3) - If expr1 is TRUE (expr1 <> 0 and expr1 <> NULL) then IF() returns expr2; otherwise it returns expr3. IF() returns a numeric or string value, depending on the context in which it is used.

routine.name: java_method

routine.name: json_tuple
routine.Comment: json_tuple(jsonStr, p1, p2, ..., pn) - like get_json_object, but it takes multiple names and return a tuple. All the input parameters and output column types are string.

routine.name: lag
routine.Comment: LAG (scalar_expression [,offset] [,default]) OVER ([query_partition_clause] order_by_clause); The LAG function is used to access data from a previous row.

routine.name: last_day

routine.name: least

routine.name: likeall

routine.name: likeany
routine.Comment: test likeany(pattern1, pattern2...) - returns true if test matches any patterns patternN. Returns NULL if the expression on the left hand side is NULL or if one of the patterns in the list is NULL.

routine.name: percentile_approx
routine.Comment: percentile_approx(expr, pc, [nb]) - For very large data, computes an approximate percentile value from a histogram, using the optional argument [nb] as the number of histogram bins to use. A higher value of nb results in a more accurate approximation, at the cost of higher memory usage.

routine.Comment: substr(str, pos[, len]) - returns the substring of str that starts at pos and is of length len orsubstr(bin, pos[, len]) - returns the slice of byte array that starts at pos and is of length len

routine.name: substring
routine.Comment: substring(str, pos[, len]) - returns the substring of str that starts at pos and is of length len orsubstring(bin, pos[, len]) - returns the slice of byte array that starts at pos and is of length len

routine.name: substring_index
routine.Comment: substring_index(str, delim, count) - Returns the substring from string str before count occurrences of the delimiter delim.

routine.name: sum
routine.Comment: sum(x) - Returns the sum of a set of numbers

routine.name: tan
routine.Comment: tan(x) - returns the tangent of x (x is in radians)

routine.name: to_date
routine.Comment: to_date(expr) - Extracts the date part of the date or datetime expression expr

routine.name: to_epoch_milli
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'to_epoch_milli'

routine.name: to_unix_timestamp
routine.Comment: to_unix_timestamp(date[, pattern]) - Returns the UNIX timestamp

routine.name: to_utc_timestamp
routine.Comment: to_utc_timestamp(timestamp, string timezone) - Assumes given timestamp is in given timezone and converts to UTC (as of Hive 0.8.0)

routine.name: translate
routine.Comment: translate(input, from, to) - translates the input string by replacing the characters present in the from string with the corresponding characters in the to string

routine.name: trim
routine.Comment: trim(str) - Removes the leading and trailing space characters from str

routine.name: trunc
routine.Comment: trunc(date, fmt) / trunc(N,D) - Returns If input is date returns date with the time portion of the day truncated to the unit specified by the format model fmt. If you omit fmt, then date is truncated to the nearest day. It currently only supports 'MONTH'/'MON'/'MM', 'QUARTER'/'Q' and 'YEAR'/'YYYY'/'YY' as format.If input is a number group returns N truncated to D decimal places. If D is omitted, then N is truncated to 0 places.D can be negative to truncate (make zero) D digits left of the decimal point.

routine.name: ucase
routine.Comment: ucase(str) - Returns str with all characters changed to uppercase

routine.name: udftoboolean
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftoboolean'

routine.name: udftobyte
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftobyte'

routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftodouble'

routine.name: udftofloat
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftofloat'

routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftointeger'

routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftolong'

routine.name: udftoshort
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftoshort'

routine.name: udftostring
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'udftostring'

routine.name: unbase64
routine.Comment: unbase64(str) - Convert the argument from a base 64 string to binary

routine.name: unhex
routine.Comment: unhex(str) - Converts hexadecimal argument to binary

routine.name: unix_timestamp
routine.Comment: unix_timestamp(date[, pattern]) - Converts the time to a number

routine.name: upper
routine.Comment: upper(str) - Returns str with all characters changed to uppercase

routine.name: uuid
routine.Comment: uuid() - Returns a universally unique identifier (UUID) string.

routine.name: var_pop
routine.Comment: var_pop(x) - Returns the variance of a set of numbers

routine.name: var_samp
routine.Comment: var_samp(x) - Returns the sample variance of a set of numbers.

routine.name: variance
routine.Comment: variance(x) - Returns the variance of a set of numbers

routine.name: version
routine.Comment: version() - Returns the Hive build version string - includes base version and revision.

routine.name: weekofyear
routine.Comment: weekofyear(date) - Returns the week of the year of the given date. A week is considered to start on a Monday and week 1 is the first week with >3 days.

routine.name: width_bucket
routine.Comment: width_bucket(expr, min_value, max_value, num_buckets) - Returns an integer between 0 and num_buckets+1 by mapping the expr into buckets defined by the range [min_value, max_value]

routine.name: windowingtablefunction
routine.Comment: There is no documentation for function 'windowingtablefunction'

routine.name: xpath
routine.Comment: xpath(xml, xpath) - Returns a string array of values within xml nodes that match the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_boolean
routine.Comment: xpath_boolean(xml, xpath) - Evaluates a boolean xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_double
routine.Comment: xpath_double(xml, xpath) - Returns a double value that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_float
routine.Comment: xpath_float(xml, xpath) - Returns a float value that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_int
routine.Comment: xpath_int(xml, xpath) - Returns an integer value that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_long
routine.Comment: xpath_long(xml, xpath) - Returns a long value that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_number
routine.Comment: xpath_number(xml, xpath) - Returns a double value that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_short
routine.Comment: xpath_short(xml, xpath) - Returns a short value that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: xpath_string
routine.Comment: xpath_string(xml, xpath) - Returns the text contents of the first xml node that matches the xpath expression

routine.name: year
routine.Comment: year(param) - Returns the year component of the date/timestamp/interval
